title: High-Skill AI Wage Premium by 2030
description: Projected change in wages for workers with strong AI/ML skills relative to the median, measuring the emerging 'AI premium' in compensation.

overlays.label: NVIDIA: median comp $301K, headcount up 21.6% YoY
OpenAI: avg stock comp $1.5M; researcher total comp $763K–$1.44M
Noy & Zhang: low-ability workers gain most from AI
QJE: less experienced workers improve most with AI
Lightcast: 51% of AI job postings now outside IT; 800% growth in non-tech gen AI roles since 2022
IMF: postings with 4+ new skills pay up to 15% more
Althoff & Reichardt: Architects, engineers, executives see absolute wage declines

sources.title: AI Job Postings and Salary Trends
The AI Talent Landscape: Skills, Demand, and Compensation
Microsoft FY24 Q3 Press Release
sources.excerpt: Microsoft Cloud revenue was $35.1 billion, up 23%. More than 65% of the Fortune 500 now use Azure OpenAI Service, and $100M+ Azure deals increased over 80% YoY.

sources.title: AI talent comes at a 30% salary premium
sources.excerpt: Companies hiring AI talent face a 30% salary premium as demand far outstrips supply, with experts warning that the cost of delayed AI hiring will only increase over time.

sources.title: Artificial Intelligence and Jobs: Evidence from Online Vacancies
sources.publisher: Journal of Labor Economics (Acemoglu, Autor, Hazell, Restrepo)
sources.excerpt: AI-exposed establishments reduce hiring in non-AI positions. A wage premium of 11% exists for job postings requiring AI skills within the same firm.

sources.title: Beyond the Buzz: Developing the AI Skills Employers Actually Need
sources.excerpt: Analysis of 1.3B job postings finds AI skills command 28% salary premium (~$18K/year); 43% for workers with 2+ AI skills. 51% of AI-skill postings now outside IT/CS with 800% growth in non-tech gen AI roles since 2022.

sources.title: NVIDIA 2025 Proxy Statement
sources.excerpt: NVIDIA median employee total compensation was $301,233 in FY2025 (ending January 2025), with CEO-to-median pay ratio of 166:1. Total headcount reached 36,000, a 21.6% increase YoY.

sources.title: OpenAI is paying workers $1.5 million in stock-based compensation on average
sources.excerpt: OpenAI average stock-based compensation reached $1.5M per employee in 2025. Research scientist total compensation ranges from $763K to $1.44M. The company raised $6.6B in October 2024 at a $157B valuation.

sources.title: AI reports and resources
sources.excerpt: LinkedIn's AI skills resources hub tracking AI engineering talent growth (130% increase since 2016). 7 out of every 1,000 LinkedIn members globally are AI engineering talent.

sources.title: PwC AI Jobs Barometer 2025: The AI Wage Premium
sources.excerpt: Workers with AI skills now command a 56% wage premium over non-AI peers, up from 25% just one year prior. AI roles median compensation reaches $157K.

sources.title: AI Salary Statistics 2026: Global Compensation Trends
sources.excerpt: AI/ML engineers median total compensation reached $185K in 2025, with top-tier researchers commanding $500K-$1M+. The premium over general software roles widened to 35%.

sources.title: Experimental Evidence on the Productivity Effects of Generative Artificial Intelligence
sources.excerpt: ChatGPT compressed productivity distribution — low-ability workers gained most (40% time reduction, 18% quality increase). May reduce skill premium over time.

sources.title: Generative AI at Work
sources.excerpt: AI assistance increases customer service worker productivity by 15% on average. Less experienced workers improve most; AI disseminates best practices from top performers.

sources.title: Bridging Skill Gaps for the Future: New Jobs Creation in the AI Age
sources.excerpt: Job postings with 4+ new skills pay up to 15% more (UK) and 8.5% more (US); middle-skill roles being squeezed while high-skill workers gain.

sources.title: Task-Specific Technical Change and Comparative Advantage
sources.excerpt: some occupations — such as architects, engineers, and executives — see absolute wage declines

sources.title: Labor Market Effects of Generative AI
sources.excerpt: Adoption concentrated among younger, college-educated, higher-earning employees, reinforcing wage premium for AI-complementary skills.
